result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A. Garcia-Limas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose A. Garcia-Limas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jose A. Garcia-Limas was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay $200 fine plus costs (mandatory assessments required by statute)
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission
Reminder Notice

Count 1:  Non-Probation
    Count 2:  Dismissed

10:22 a.m.  Defendant Jose A. Garcia-Limas in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Jambois calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Jambois indicates that an amended information has been filed in this case.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Amended Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - Dismissed 

Court questions the defendant in re:  Waiver of Right to Counsel.
Court questions defendant regarding plea.
Court informs defendant of the constitutional rights. 
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Defendant signs the Plea Questionnaire as of today's date in the courtroom.
Parties stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Amended Count 1 - 4th Degree Sexual Assault and Count 2 is Dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present and does not object to the disposition of this case as stated on the record.

Atty Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant does not wish to make any statements prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Pay $200 fine plus costs  (Mandatory Assessments required by Statute)
Submit DNA Sample
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office
Interpreter confirmation

01:30 PM Defendant Jose A. Garcia-Limas in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:30 p.m. Court calls the case and states the appearances.
Court reviews the file.
Court questions Mr. Garcia-Limas as to whereabouts.
Mr. Garcia-Limas states he lives in San Diego, CA.
Court questions Mr. Garcia-Limas as to contacting an atty.
Mr. Garcia-Limas responds and states he called the office and found about the warrant and came to Stevens Point, WI to clear this matter up.
Court continues to question Mr. Garcia-Limas.
Mr. Garcia-Limas responds.
Court reviews the file.
Court questions ADA Mukoski.
ADA Mukoski responds.
Court questions Mr. Garcia-Limas as to obtaining an atty.
Mr. Garcia-Limas responds.

BY THE COURT:
Matter to be set for a Pre-Trial Conference on 05/28/2019 at 10:00 a.m. in Branch 2.

Court questions ADA Mukoski as to bond.
ADA Mukoski makes statements to the Court with regards to bond.
Court questions Mr. Garcia-Limas as to bond.
Mr. Garcia-Limas makes statements to the Court regarding bond and his flight home.
Court responds.
Court continues to question Mr. Garcia-Limas.
Mr. Garcia-Limas responds.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is set in the amount of $500.00 cash. Previously ordered $25,000.00 signature bond is also reinstated. Court will a combination bond of $500.00 cash and $24,500.00 signature bond.
Mr. Garcia-Limas is ordered to report to the public defender's office today to see about obtaining an attorney.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Body Only. Statewide.

Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:37 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter was set for a pretrial today following Defendant's failure to appear at the last pretrial.

Defendant has not appeared today.
State requests a warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a statewide body only warrant.

Atty Schmidt states that Defendant is not living in the area.
Pre-trial conference on February 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:13 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.  
This is a final pre-trial.
Court questions the whereabouts of the defendant.  Atty. Schmidt makes a statement to the court.  
Court questions Attorney Schmidt re: contact with defendant.  ADA Knaapen makes a statement to the court re: status of the matter.  
ADA requests that cancel the jury but leave the matter scheduled for February 1, 2017 in anticipation of a plea on that date.  
Court states there are other trials set on that date.  

BTC:
Take off the trial and set a pre-trial conference at 2/1/2017 at 8:30 a.m.  If the defendant is present on that date, court will take his plea and set for sentencing if not able.  
If the defendant fails to appear for that pre-trial the court will discuss warrant on that date.
2:23 p.m. case is adjourned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Jury trial on February 1, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on January 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose A. Garcia-Limas
Current: 5402 West 23rd  Place, Cicero, IL 60804 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2016)
Prior: 602 E Washington St, New London, WI 54961 United States
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. Defendant does not appear in Court.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Schmidt does not know where is client currently is and makes statements.
9:32 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court questions Atty Schmidt if he has heard from his client recently; Atty Schmidt makes statements on the record.
Atty Schmidt would like to attempt to contact him by phone.
Atty Schmidt indicates that his client is an over the road truck driver. 
Court questions if there is a cash bond; Atty Knaapen states it is a signature bond.
Motions in Limine have been provided to the defense and the Court by the State.
Atty Schmidt makes further statements.
Court questions the residence of the defendant; Atty Schmidt indicates that the New London address sounds correct.
Atty Schmidt provides another address for the defendant of 1613 Pinewood Lane #8, Hudson, WI  54016.
Notice for Final Pre-Trial had not been returned when mailed to the New London address.
Court questions Atty Knaapen if he would seek a warrant.
Atty Knaapen indicates that he would and makes statements.
Atty Schmidt states that he had received this morning, Discovery from the State and indicates that he has not had time to review.
Atty Schmidt states that he will need time to review the Discovery he received today from the State.
Atty Schmidt would request a continuance.
Atty Knaapen states that a large portion of the Discovery provided to Atty Schmidt today he had been provided with prior to today's date.
Atty Schmidt makes further statements.
Court is concerned about the no-show of the defendant.
Atty Knaapen states that if a warrant is authorized/issued then a pre-trial does not need to be set and makes further statements.
Atty Schmidt makes his statements regarding the warrant and opposes the issuance of a warrant and would request a new pre-trial hearing.
Atty Schmidt states that if a bench warrant is issued that there be a low cash alternative.
Court makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Trial date to be adjourned.
Pre-Trial Conference to be set.
Clerk to send notice to both addresses for the defendant.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 21, 2016 at 08:00 am.

3:51 p.m. Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose A. Garcia-Limas appeared by phone. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin. Motion for Continuance is filed by the State.  ADA Knaapen states the reasons for the motion. Atty Schmidt explains the attached documents to the Court as impeachment and/or rebuttal purposes and request motion to be denied. ADA Knaapen make final statements and mentions that there is an interpreter scheduled for the afternoon for the victim, but unable to get one for tomorrow morning.
BTC: State's Motion for Continuance is granted.
Jury trial cancelled for tomorrow.
Court will set a scheduling order for the Parties to follow so as to avoid this issue happening again.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
